attributes.comment:
My comments are concerning docket number USCIS-2006- 0044, the proposed increase in fees
for families who adopt internationally. My husband and I recently adopted a newborn daughter
from Zambia. If the increased fee were to take effect, it would cause an additional financial
burden to our family. International adoption is already so expensive, that increasing the fee
would only burden us more. We are only trying to create a family.

I propose that the people who work in immigration get a decrease in pay instead. I have never
been treated so poorly in my life as I did in the immigration office. It is laughable that this slow,
and demeaning experience should cost more than it already does. Now, if the increase in fees
would mean that the service would change from slow and demeaning to fast and service-with-a-
smile, I might not be complaining. But as it is, I was amazed that I paid so much money to be
treated so poorly. When I shell out that much money, I expect better service. If the proposed
fee increases come into effect, I expect better service. Or at the very least, terminate Rebecca
Davis' employment. She works in Utah.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Robyn D. Brown
